awd_titl_txt: Electrical Conductivity Measurements at the McMurdo Dome    Core
awd_abstract_narration: It is widely recognized that the earth's climate is dynamic and                 that significant changes have occurred in the past.                             Paleoenvironmental records from ice cores are an important tool for             understanding the processes responsible for previous climate                    changes.  This award supports the measurement of the electrical                 conductivity of an ice core that will be drilled at McMurdo Dome,               Antarctica in 1992-1993.  Specific objectives of this proposal are:             (1) to assist in determining the age/depth relation for the McMurdo             Dome core and to provide the location of stratigraphic marker                   horizons; (2) to identify segments of the core that have anomalous              chemical characteristics so that other research groups can direct               their efforts to significant, short duration features and; (3)                  provide a record of the volcanic activity that has affected the                 area.

inst.inst_name: Nevada System of Higher Education, Desert Research Institute
